unnormalised: I remember when my dad, Mr. Sharma, used to pore over the annual reports of SBI. He'd spend hours comparing the profit from FY22-23 which was ₹31,645 Cr to the projected ₹35,000 Cr for FY23-24. He'd then analyze the dividend yield of 1.2% versus the interest rates offered on fixed deposits (FDs) which were around 7.5% back then. He always said, "Numbers don't lie, beta. They tell the whole story, if you know how to read them!"
normalised: I remember when my dad, Mister Sharma, used to pore over the annual reports of S-B-I. He'd spend hours comparing the profit from financial year twenty twenty two to twenty twenty three which was rupee thirty one thousand six hundred and forty five crore to the projected rupee thirty five thousand crore for financial year twenty twenty three to twenty twenty four. He'd then analyze the dividend yield of one point two percent versus the interest rates offered on fixed deposits (F-D-s) which were around seven point five percent back then. He always said, "Numbers don't lie, beta. They tell the whole story, if you know how to read them!"
